thread.title: Britain Joins Electronics Ban As Reports Link Ban to SEALs’ Raid In Yemen
thread.title_full: Britain Joins Electronics Ban As Reports Link Ban to SEALs’ Raid In Yemen

author: Jack Davis
title: Britain Joins Electronics Ban As Reports Link Ban to SEALs’ Raid In Yemen
text:
CNN Interview Interrupted After GOP Congressman Cites Refugee Terrorism Stats [Video] 
“Safety of the travelling public is our highest priority. That is why we keep aviation security under constant review and put in place measures that are necessary, effective and proportionate,” the spokesman added. 
In announcing its electronics ban, the Department of Homeland Security stated , “Evaluated intelligence indicates that terrorist groups continue to target commercial aviation, to include smuggling explosive devices in various consumer items.” Intel saying al Qaeda is working to put explosives in batteries led to airline electronics ban, US official says. https://t.co/xRCSYxqMAq pic.twitter.com/wIgXgI0xMc 
— CNN Breaking News (@cnnbrk) March 21, 2017   
As evidence, the DHS cited “the 2015 airliner downing in Egypt, the 2016 attempted airliner downing in Somalia, and the 2016 armed attacks against airports in Brussels and Istanbul.” 
Media reports indicated that the intelligence that triggered the ban was gathered in a January raid in Yemen in which Navy SEAL William “Ryan” Owens was killed. WATCH: U.S. officials tell @CBSNews the airline electronics ban is a byproduct of gathered intelligence. https://t.co/uW83XjRc8O pic.twitter.com/yXNyELpkzH 
— CBS This Morning (@CBSThisMorning) March 22, 2017 
CNN reported that al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula has been pursuing increased bomb-making capability. Reuters reported that since the raid, U.S. officials have been considering the electronics ban.
